creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: irregular grouping of rocks at bottom center with red tree trunks and two figures seated facing each other on a flat clearing; small fleet of sailboats and a fishing boat in water at center; island with rocky shore, a few huts, and red tree trunks at R; mountains in distance
inscription: 風月誰為主　河濱独結廬　任他生計拙　舜亦学陶漁 (Wind and moon - who is their master? / By riverside alone I\'ve built my hut. / So what if my plan for life is clumsy? / Even Shun made pottery and fished) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #3]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4], 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LLC red seal: 拙居 {sekkyo}
signed: 古道人詩畫 {Kodōjin shiga} (poem and painting by Kodōjin)
title: Wind and Moon by the Riverside
